Comparing galvanic and electrolytic cells

Complete the table comparing galvanic and electrolytic cells below.

You may only use the following words:

separate same one cell oxidation non-spontaneous
reduction electrical chemical batteries positive
negative spontaneous two half-cells electrolysis

Galvanic cell Electrolytic cell
Chemical reactions 1. ____ reactions non-spontaneous reactions
Energy changes 2. ____ potential energy to electrical energy electrical energy to 3. ____ potential energy
Anode has a negative charge, 4. ____ occurs at this electrode has a positive charge, oxidation occurs at this electrode
Cathode has a positive charge, 5. ____ at this electrode has a negative charge, reduction at this electrode
Cell set-up two half-cells, one electrode in each, connected by a salt bridge one cell, two electrodes, no salt bridge
Electrolyte solution(s) separate electrolyte solutions connected by a salt bridge same electrolyte solution
Applications batteries electrolysis
Answer:

ID is: 2403 Seed is: 1926

Rechargeable batteries

Rechargeable batteries are found in laptops, tablets, cellphones, music players, cars and many other places. These batteries all rely on reversible electrochemical reactions.

A NiMH battery is an example of a rechargeable battery. This battery uses a metal hydride (MH) and nickel oxide-hydroxide (NiO(OH)) as electrodes and potassium hydroxide (KOH) as the electrolyte.

  1. When the battery is being used the oxidation half-reaction involves MH(s) and M(s) is formed. The reduction half-reaction involves NiO(OH)(s) and Ni(OH)2(aq) is formed.

    This reaction takes place in an alkaline medium.

    Write a balanced chemical equation (including spectator ions) for the cathode half-reaction for when the battery is being used.

    INSTRUCTION: Remember to include state symbols in your answer.
    Answer:
    chemequation

  2. When the battery is being charged the oxidation half-reaction involves Ni(OH)2(aq) and NiO(OH)(s) is formed. The reduction half-reaction involves M(s) and MH(s) is formed.

    This reaction takes place in an alkaline medium.

    Write a balanced chemical equation for the overall cell reaction for when the battery is being charged.

    INSTRUCTION: Remember to include state symbols in your answer.
    Answer:
    one-of
    type(chemequation)

  3. The following reduction electrode potentials are given for the cell:

    • −0,4 V−0,4 V
    • 1,6 V1,6 V

    Calculate the emf of the cell when it is charging.

    Answer: 𝐸𝜃cell=Ecellθ= VV
    numeric

  4. Is the reaction that takes place when the battery is in use a spontaneous or non-spontaneous reaction?

    Answer:
